title: I have never met a player with broken English that wasn't cancerous, toxic and abusive.
body: In most of my games, the player is usually Chinese, and becomes enraged when someone takes his role. He then proceeds to either feed, troll, or play normally but spam chat with insults usually directed at my mother. Common examples include "YOUR MOTHER IS SUCK!!" "YOUR MOTHER BOOM BOOM!!!" and "FUXX YOU!!!" as well as spamming the chat with spam directed towards the player who took their role. Usually they'll say something like " (Insert champion name here) RUBBISH!!!" before minions have even spawned. They continue to say those things whether the player is doing good or not. This trend has been occurring for so long that I'm starting to think that these players are abusive bots. Is anyone else seeing this pattern/trend when playing with/against foreigners with broken English or is this only happening to me?

replies.body:

Hey there Arachno Flame,

I understand your concern as I too have encountered numerous players with poor literacy skills. But that does not necessarily mean the player is CHINESE. As I myself am Chinese. Whilst sometimes the situation can be factored down to being a foreign player I believe that most of the time it is due to the player 'rush typing' during times of elevated heart rate which can occur when you get stressed over 'your role being taken' or similar situations. I say this because I've noticed that at times when I've been in situations that I have felt uncomfortable my typing also goes 'full %%%%%%'. 

With that said there is no need to pin poor literacy skills solely on race. But if a player is being verbally abusive you are able to report them in client in the game statistics screen. In addition you can screen shot any foul language and send them in a SUPPORT ticket. 

Regards,
lols =)

In my entire 4 years of playing I have only met the "broken English rager" (and who actually looks like from somewhere outside of the OCE region) once, he was playing a Fiora and was angry at me taking top.

Not to mention there is no guarantee that the broken English is entirely the result of using a secondary language, you know, there is still a great deal amount of people who can't type their first language in a coherent manner, whatever the language it may be. And it's not like we're all expecting/typing perfect English in-game to begin with.

So tbh assuming all the broken English rage are all in fact from overseas is simply not true.

EDIT: Not to mention, those who type with broken English is generally raging to begin with, but that doesn't only mean that he is from overseas.
